results.title: Farm boy of Hungary
results.creator_credit: Vue Touristique Film Studios and Gabor Kalman
results.brief_description: The pace, feel, and values of the rural way of life that is still a part of Central Europe today. Lajos, a farm boy, is shown living the normal life in Hungary. Modern conveniences may be lacking, but Lajos and his family “have everything we need”.

results.title: Farewell Arabia
results.creator_credit: International Television Federation, Rediffusion and Randal Beattie
results.brief_description: An account of what the discovery of oil has done to the tiny sheikdom of Abu Dhabi whose population of 200,000 were still living a simple life. The film shows the continuity of old customs and the incursion of new pressures brought about by foreign salesmen wanting to sell their goods and expertise in return for the oil-fed dollars. Also shows 20th century medicine trying to battle TB, eye diseases and the traditionalism of the people. Written and narrated by David Holden.

results.title: Far East
results.brief_description: A political thriller which exposes the violent and exploitative realities of multi-national companies in SE Asia. Against this background, three Australians drift between stability and desperation. This is a tough story of human emotions stretched to the limit by war, love and mystery. Cast includes Helen Morse and Bryan Brown.

results.title: Fantasia Di Botticelli: La Calunnia
results.creator_credit: Romor Film and Carlo Carlo Ludovico Ragghianti
results.brief_description: The Florentine painter Sandro Botticelli was one of the greatest products of the Renaissance. His sinuous and telling outlines are so exceptionally decorative and expressive that they place his work amongst the finest creations in the history of art. His admiration of classical art is most powerfully evident in his recreation of “Calumny”, a lost masterpiece painted by a Greek artist Apelles in the third Century B.C. “The Calumny” is the centre point of the film around which the developing style of Botticelli is examined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Romor Film and Carlo Carlo Ludovico Ragghianti
